headline.print_headline: Indictment Said to Be Near for Man Charged in Terror Case
headline.seo: Indictment of Jose Pimentel in Terror Case Is Said to Be Near
headline.main: Indictment Said to Be Near for Man Charged in Terror Case

docs.snippet: A lawyer for a Jose Pimentel, a Manhattan man who the police say intended to detonate bombs in the city, said she did not know what the grand jury charges would be....
docs.abstract: Susan J Walsh, lawyer for a Jose Pimentel, a Manhattan man charged with making bombs with intent to detonate them in New York City, says she expects Pimentel to be indicted but she does not know what the grand jury charges will be.
docs.lead_paragraph: A lawyer for a Jose Pimentel, a Manhattan man who the police say intended to detonate bombs in the city, said she did not know what the grand jury charges would be.

docs.snippet: The two common explanations — call it the Republican narrative and the German narrative — are just wrong....
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column asserts that the fundamental reason why economic conditions in Europe continue to be so poor is the euro; argues that it is crucial to understand the root of the problem in this way because many will use the situation in Europe to advocate for bad policies based on misunderstandings and falsehoods.
docs.lead_paragraph: The two common explanations — call it the Republican narrative and the German narrative — are just wrong.

docs.snippet: The Yankees’ expected starting rotation, led by C. C. Sabathia (6 feet 7 inches, 290 pounds) and Michael Pineda (6-7, 280), is among the biggest in baseball history....
docs.abstract: New York Yankees’ expected starting rotation, led by C C Sabathia at 6 feet 7 inches, 290 pounds, and Michael Pineda at 6-7, 280, is among the beefiest in baseball history.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees’ expected starting rotation, led by C. C. Sabathia (6 feet 7 inches, 290 pounds) and Michael Pineda (6-7, 280), is among the biggest in baseball history.

headline.print_headline: Blurred Line Between Espionage And Truth
headline.seo: White House Uses Espionage Act to Pursue Leak Cases
headline.main: Blurred Line Between Espionage and Truth

docs.snippet: After promising to enhance whistle-blower laws to protect federal workers, the Obama administration has used the Espionage Act as a kind of ad hoc Official Secrets Act....

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: David Carr The Media Equation column observes the Obama administration, after promising to enhance whistle-blower laws to protect federal workers, has used the Espionage Act six times to bring cases against government officials accused of providing classified information to the media; points out cases have everything to do with secrecy but very little to do with national security.
docs.lead_paragraph: After promising to enhance whistle-blower laws to protect federal workers, the Obama administration has used the Espionage Act as a kind of ad hoc Official Secrets Act.

headline.seo: Chamique Holdsclaw Is Sharing Her Struggles Off the Court
headline.main: On the Court, Finding an Outlet, and a Voice

docs.snippet: Chamique Holdsclaw, who battled depression while starring at Christ the King High School in New York City and at Tennessee and in the W.N.B.A., is becoming an ambassador for Active Minds, a mental health advocacy group....
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column profiles Chamique Holdsclaw, WNBA star who is becoming an ambassador for mental health advocacy group Active Minds; notes that Holdsclaw's calling comes from personal experience with depression.
docs.lead_paragraph: Chamique Holdsclaw, who battled depression while starring at Christ the King High School in New York City and at Tennessee and in the W.N.B.A., is becoming an ambassador for Active Minds, a mental health advocacy group.

headline.print_headline: A Passion for Basketball, Made Even Stronger by Lin’s Emergence
headline.seo: Asian-American Players Show Their Love of the Game
headline.main: A Passion for Basketball, Made Even Stronger by Lin’s Emergence

docs.snippet: Asian-Americans displayed their love of the game at a tournament in Hillburn, N.Y. Even before Jeremy Lin’s emergence, they had fallen for the sport....
docs.abstract: Thriving Asian-American basketball leagues have existed for years, long before New York Knicks point guard Jeremy Lin surged to stardom; league members see Lin's success as an eye-opener rather than a novelty, bringing nation's belated attention to their love of the sport.
docs.lead_paragraph: Asian-Americans displayed their love of the game at a tournament in Hillburn, N.Y. Even before Jeremy Lin’s emergence, they had fallen for the sport.

headline.main: Amid a Federal Education Inquiry, an Unsettling Sight

docs.snippet: Education Secretary Arne Duncan recently appeared on a panel with Michelle Rhee, the former head of the same Washington school district that his department is now investigating....
docs.abstract: Michael Winerip On Education column scrutinizes why Education Secretary Arne Duncan appeared on a panel with Michelle Rhee, the former head of the same Washington school district that his department is now investigating.
docs.lead_paragraph: Education Secretary Arne Duncan recently appeared on a panel with Michelle Rhee, the former head of the same Washington school district that his department is now investigating.

headline.print_headline: Green Book, the City’s Long-Out-of-Date Directory, Is to Get a New, Online Edition
headline.seo: Green Book, Official N.Y.C. Directory, Is to Go Online
headline.main: Green Book, the City’s Long-Out-of-Date Directory, Is to Get a New, Online Edition

docs.snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s administration, which has not updated the bible of government information since 2008, plans to publish it this spring on the Web and in print....
docs.abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's administration has not updated the Green Book, a comprehensive directory of New York City's agencies that was once published annually, since the 2008-9 edition; city plans to update book in Spring 2012 and publish its contents online; a limited number of copies of the printed version would be available for sale, but the city clearly intends for the digital version to be the primary one.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s administration, which has not updated the bible of government information since 2008, plans to publish it this spring on the Web and in print.

headline.print_headline: Because U.S. Erred in ’90, Bronx Resident Becomes a Man Without a Country
headline.seo: U.S. Error Costs Bronx Resident From Yemen His Citizenship
headline.main: Because U.S. Erred in ’90, Bronx Resident Becomes a Man Without a Country

docs.snippet: American officials told Abdo Hizam, a Yemen native who immigrated in 1990, that they were effectively revoking the citizenship he had been awarded as a child....
docs.abstract: State Department revokes passport of Yemeni-American Abdo Hizam, saying that he received his citizenship in error due to bureaucratic error made by government in 1990; Hizam has filed a lawsuit against the government, demanding that it affirm his citizenship and reissue his passport.
docs.lead_paragraph: American officials told Abdo Hizam, a Yemen native who immigrated in 1990, that they were effectively revoking the citizenship he had been awarded as a child.
